questions.question_text:
You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. The primary audience for your instance of audience insights is business accounts. You need to show audience insights data to Dynamics 365 Sales users without updating data in Dataverse.
Which Customer Card Add-in controls requires you to create semantic entity mapping before you can use it?

discussion.content:
I don't know what the correct answer is, but Microsoft Learn says that Demographics from Experian and Identity from LiveRamp currently only support enriching customer profiles from the United States only, so I'm fairly certain answers A and C are INCORRECT. 

Location from HERE Technologies doesn't exist, though Location from Azure Maps does.

SFTP custom import doesn't seem correct, either, though. This question makes no sense.

questions.question_text:
Your company has recently implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights to target customers based on household size and income. The company's Marketing team plans to create different segments for customers living in Canada based on household size and income.

Customer profiles are currently missing this information, and the marketing team requests this data be added to Dynamics 365 Customer Insights for as many customers as possible in Canada.

You need to ensure that as many customer profiles as possible are enriched with household and income size details.

What type of enrichment should you use to bring in data to satisfy the requirement?

You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. Some of the data your company stores need to adhere to strict organization compliance and security when establishing connections and exports. Your information technology department tells you that you must use a dedicated Azure key vault with your audience insights environment to help the organization meet its compliance requirements. The dedicated key vault will be used to stage and use secrets in an organization's compliance boundary.
Which two statements are true about using audience insights and Azure Key Vault to store the secrets for each of the connections set up?
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: The key vault must have Key Vault firewall enabled.
choices.A: You must have administrator role in audience insights.
choices.C: The key vault is in the same Azure location as the audience insights environment.
choices.D: Audience insights can write secrets or overwrite secrets into the key vault.

questions.question_text:
You successfully installed the Customer Card Add-in and the required add-in control in the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales app.

You need to show customer enrichment data from Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights in the Dynamics 365 Sales application.

Which two conditions are required for the enrichment data to show on a customer card in Dynamics 365 Sales? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Active enrichment is applied to customer profiles.
choices.A: Customer details control is successfully installed and added to the Contact form.
choices.C: Contacts from Dynamics 365 Sales are included in the Dynamics 365 Customer Insights unification process.
choices.B: Measure Control is successfully installed and added to the Contact form.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct

1. Install the Customer Card Add-in
2. Configure the Customer Card Add-in
3. Add Customer Card controls to forms
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/customer-card-add-in

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Your organization uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service in its contact center.

You need to use the Customer Card Add-in to make customer profile data from Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights available to contact center users. The organization wants you to follow Microsoft's best practices and recommendations.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//
